```py
> subject_name <- c("John Doe", "Jane Doe", "Steve Graves")
> temperature <- c(98.1, 98.6, 101.4)
> flu_status <- c(FALSE, FALSE, TRUE)

```

```py
> gender <- factor(c("MALE", "FEMALE", "MALE"))
> gender
[1] MALE   FEMALE MALE
Levels: FEMALE MALE

```

```py
> blood <- factor(c("O", "AB", "A"),
 levels = c("A", "B", "AB", "O"))
> blood[1:2]
[1] O  AB
Levels: A B AB O

```

```py
> symptoms <- factor(c("SEVERE", "MILD", "MODERATE"),
 levels = c("MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE"),
 ordered = TRUE)

```

```py
> symptoms
[1] SEVERE   MILD     MODERATE
Levels: MILD < MODERATE < SEVERE

```

```py
> subject_name[1]
[1] "John Doe"
> temperature[1]
[1] 98.1
> flu_status[1]
[1] FALSE
> gender[1]
[1] MALE
Levels: FEMALE MALE
> blood[1]
[1] O
Levels: A B AB O
> symptoms[1]
[1] SEVERE
Levels: MILD < MODERATE < SEVERE

```

```py
> subject1 <- list(fullname = subject_name[1],
 temperature = temperature[1],
 flu_status = flu_status[1],
 gender = gender[1],
 blood = blood[1],
 symptoms = symptoms[1])

```

```py
> subject1
$fullname
[1] "John Doe"

$temperature
[1] 98.1

$flu_status
[1] FALSE

$gender
[1] MALE
Levels: FEMALE MALE

$blood
[1] O
Levels: A B AB O

$symptoms
[1] SEVERE
Levels: MILD < MODERATE < SEVERE

```

```py
> pt_data <- data.frame(subject_name, temperature, flu_status,
 gender, blood, symptoms, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

```

```py
> pt_data
 subject_name temperature flu_status gender blood symptoms
1     John Doe        98.1      FALSE   MALE     O   SEVERE
2     Jane Doe        98.6      FALSE FEMALE    AB     MILD
3 Steve Graves       101.4       TRUE   MALE     A MODERATE

```

```py
> pt_data[c("temperature", "flu_status")]
 temperature flu_status
1        98.1      FALSE
2        98.6      FALSE
3       101.4       TRUE

```

```py
> pt_data[c(1, 3), c(2, 4)]
 temperature gender
1        98.1   MALE
3       101.4   MALE

```

```py
> pt_data[1, ]
 subject_name temperature flu_status gender blood symptoms
1     John Doe        98.1      FALSE   MALE     O   SEVERE

```

```py
> pt_data[ , ]
 subject_name temperature flu_status gender blood symptoms
1     John Doe        98.1      FALSE   MALE     O   SEVERE
2     Jane Doe        98.6      FALSE FEMALE    AB     MILD
3 Steve Graves       101.4       TRUE   MALE     A MODERATE

```

```py
> str(usedcars)
'data.frame':   150 obs. of 6 variables:
 $ year        : int  2011 2011 2011 2011 ...
 $ model       : chr  "SEL" "SEL" "SEL" "SEL" ...
 $ price       : int  21992 20995 19995 17809 ...
 $ mileage     : int  7413 10926 7351 11613 ...
 $ color       : chr  "Yellow" "Gray" "Silver" "Gray" ...
 $ transmission: chr  "AUTO" "AUTO" "AUTO" "AUTO" ...

```

```py
> summary(usedcars$year)
 Min.  1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.
 2000     2008     2009    2009   2010    2012

```

```py
> summary(usedcars[c("price", "mileage")])
 price           mileage 
 Min.   : 3800   Min.   :  4867 
 1st Qu.:10995   1st Qu.: 27200 
 Median :13592   Median : 36385 
 Mean   :12962   Mean   : 44261 
 3rd Qu.:14904   3rd Qu.: 55125 
 Max.   :21992   Max.   :151479

```

```py
> boxplot(usedcars$price, main="Boxplot of Used Car Prices",
 ylab="Price ($)")
> boxplot(usedcars$mileage, main="Boxplot of Used Car Mileage",
 ylab="Odometer (mi.)")

```

```py
> hist(usedcars$price, main = "Histogram of Used Car Prices",
 xlab = "Price ($)")
> hist(usedcars$mileage, main = "Histogram of Used Car Mileage",
 xlab = "Odometer (mi.)")

```

```py
> table(usedcars$year)
2000 2001 2002 2003 2004 2005 2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 
 3    1    1    1    3    2    6   11   14   42   49   16    1
> table(usedcars$model)
 SE SEL SES 
78  23  49
> table(usedcars$color)
 Black   Blue   Gold   Gray  Green    Red Silver  White Yellow 
 35     17      1     16      5     25     32     16      3

```

```py
> model_table <- table(usedcars$model)
> prop.table(model_table)
 SE       SEL       SES 
0.5200000 0.1533333 0.3266667

```

```py
> color_pct <- table(usedcars$color)
> color_pct <- prop.table(color_table) * 100
> round(color_pct, digits = 1)
Black   Blue   Gold   Gray  Green    Red Silver  White Yellow 
 23.3   11.3    0.7   10.7    3.3   16.7   21.3   10.7    2.0

```

```py
> plot(x = usedcars$mileage, y = usedcars$price,
 main = "Scatterplot of Price vs. Mileage",
 xlab = "Used Car Odometer (mi.)",
 ylab = "Used Car Price ($)")

```
